summary: An FBI New York Intelligence Division Tactical Intelligence Report on Malcolm Grumbridge, a person of interest and suspected potential defense witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The report compiles travel records and open-source information detailing Grumbridge's role as a Maxwell family associate and lawyer, his 2019 travel to the U.S., and his removal from the legal profession for rule breaches.

persons.name: Malcolm Grumbridge
persons.role: Person of Interest / Suspected Defense Witness
persons.context: Subject of the FBI intelligence report; identified as a Maxwell family associate, lawyer, and custodian of a Maxwell property. Investigated for potential role as a defense witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the underlying child sex trafficking investigation by FBI squad C-20. Her trial began in November 2021, and Grumbridge is a suspected defense witness for her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as an alleged perpetrator in the child sex trafficking investigation involving victims from the mid-1990s to early 2000s.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's brother. The report notes Grumbridge had involvement with companies linked to Kevin Maxwell and acted as a 'mystery benefactor' for him.

persons.name: Ian Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's brother. The report notes companies set up by Grumbridge were linked to Ian Maxwell.

connections.description: Grumbridge is described in open sources as a Maxwell family associate, friend, and lawyer who acted as custodian of her London property.
Grumbridge had involvement with companies linked to Kevin Maxwell and is noted as a 'mystery benefactor' for payments on Kevin's home.
Grumbridge set up companies registered to The Hogarth Group that were linked to Ian Maxwell.
Both are subjects of the FBI's child sex trafficking investigation for allegedly abusing victims together.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Begins
events.description: The criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell on child sex trafficking charges commenced.

events.title: Potential Defense Witness List Received
events.description: FBI New York Criminal Division squad C-20 received a potential list of defense witnesses for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Grumbridge's Last Inbound U.S. Travel
events.description: Malcolm Grumbridge last traveled inbound to the United States, arriving at JFK from London Heathrow.

events.title: Grumbridge's Last Outbound U.S. Travel
events.description: Malcolm Grumbridge departed the United States from JFK to London Heathrow.

events.title: Grumbridge Removed as Solicitor
events.description: Malcolm Grumbridge was removed from the Roll of Solicitors by the Solicitors Regulation Authority (SRA) after admitting to reckless conduct and rule breaches concerning money laundering and client verification.

locations: 44 Kinnerton St, Belgravia, London (noted as a known residence of Ghislaine Maxwell)
John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK), New York
London Heathrow International Airport, United Kingdom
Chiswick, London (location of Hogarth Health Club)
keyFacts: The FBI identified Malcolm Grumbridge as a person of interest and a suspected potential defense witness for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
Grumbridge's last travel to the United States was a four-day trip in October 2019, entering and exiting via JFK Airport.
Open-source reporting characterizes Grumbridge as a long-time Maxwell family associate, lawyer, and custodian of Ghislaine Maxwell's London property at 44 Kinnerton Street.

Grumbridge was removed from the legal profession in 2020 after an SRA investigation found breaches including failures related to money laundering, terrorist financing, and client identity verification.
The FBI report was generated to identify potential defense witnesses and gather derogatory information on them for the ongoing Maxwell trial.
